Commercials?

From the CommuniGatePro readme:

The CommuniGate Pro is a high-speed, heavily multi-threaded server application implementing extended SMTP, POP3, IMAP4rev1, MAPI, poppwd, LDAP, ACAP, and other messaging services.

So it seems commercial implementations on server side to exist. Just the clients ones not. But, using IMAP seems awkwards. HTTP PUT/WebDAV seems more suited nowadays.

ACAP server

This (http://dave.cridland.net/acap/) has an ACAP server for Linux under GPL license, an ACAP-aware IMAP client (also GPL, but this time cross platform), called Polymer, which roams using ACAP quite nicely, though I say so myself.

HTTP doesn't cut it as a configuration service on its own - there's a proposal called XCAP which does that, but it really doesn't work properly unless you put in an entire SIP stack as well.

I have been waiting for so long ...

Indeed, since 2000 or so I'm waiting for such a implementation. I'm fed up being compelle to update my imp's filters when I set up a new rule on thunderbird and vice-versa. Personaly, I think there was not, up these days, a real demand for that kind of client (the problem is the lack of ACAP-aware clients). Most traveling people use webmail accounts and professional have legacy solution via Webmail or Blackberry. With the expand of public mobile solutions like the Nokia 770 I hope there will be a new demand for that kind of thing. Polymer is being ported toe this platform. That is a good thing.
